element.title: Windowtext
element.desc: A Redmond beveled text input field.
element.longdescription:
Note: Redmond components are deprecated. Please consider using LZ Components. If you use this component, you must explicitly include the redmond library:
<include href="redmond"/>

Arguments:
password
default: FALSE
When password is TRUE, characters are replaced with asterisks (*).

multiline
default: FALSE
When multiline is TRUE, the text field will allow more than 1 line of text.

resizeable
default: FALSE
When resizeable is TRUE, the field's height and width can be changed at run time.

Description:
The windowtext tag provides a standard beveled text input area. This is similar to inputtext. This tag is one in a set of compatible window elements are also available for building Redmond windows.

Example:
See window

See also:
tabpanelview, tabview, window, windowframe, inputtext

attribute.name: multiline
attribute.desc: If true, the lines of text are wrapped to fit within the text width. (The name multiline is a misnomer. Unwrapped text can be multiple lines if it contains a <br /> or <p> element, or a line break within a <pre> element. This attribute defaults to true if width and height are explicitly specified. If you set multiline=true, you probably want to explicitly a width for the text also; if multiline=true and you do not specify a width, the system will pick an arbitrary width (100 pixels at the moment). When multiline=true, the text is automatially re-wrapped whenever the content is modified by calls to setText(), or whenever the width of the text view is modified.

attribute.name: resize
attribute.desc: If true, the width of the text field will be recomputed each time setText() is called, so that the text view is exactly as wide as the width of the widest line.

attribute.name: selectable
attribute.desc: If true, the text is selectable

attribute.name: password
attribute.desc: If true, the input text field acts like a password input field; any text typed in appears as "****" characters in the current font.

tag.name: windowtext
tag.desc: An editable text field with a border. See the documentation for the text tag for a description of the width and height attributes, and of scrolling.
